title: Introduction to TypeScript
content: TypeScript is a strongly typed superset of JavaScript that compiles to plain JavaScript. It adds optional static typing, interfaces, and advanced tooling support.
questions: What is TypeScript?
Difference between JavaScript and TypeScript?
Why use TypeScript in large projects?

title: TypeScript Basic Types
content: TypeScript provides types like number, string, boolean, array, tuple, enum, any, unknown, void, null, undefined, and never.
questions: What is the difference between 'any' and 'unknown'?
Explain tuples in TypeScript.
What is the 'never' type used for?

title: Type Inference & Type Annotations
content: TypeScript can infer types automatically, but explicit type annotations help improve code readability and catch errors early.
questions: What is type inference in TypeScript?
How to explicitly annotate types for variables, functions, and objects?
What happens if TypeScript cannot infer a type?

title: Functions in TypeScript
content: TypeScript allows typing for function parameters, return types, and supports optional and default parameters.
questions: How to define function parameter types?
How to define return type of a function?
What are optional and default parameters?

title: Interfaces
content: Interfaces define the shape of objects, enforce contracts, and enable better code organization. Classes can implement interfaces.
questions: What is an interface?
Difference between type and interface?
How do classes implement interfaces?

title: Classes & Object-Oriented Programming
content: TypeScript supports classes, inheritance, access modifiers (public, private, protected), abstract classes, and static members.
questions: How to define a class in TypeScript?
What are access modifiers?
Difference between abstract class and interface?

title: Generics
content: Generics allow creating reusable components and functions that work with different data types while preserving type safety.
questions: What are generics in TypeScript?
How to create a generic function or class?
What is the difference between generic and any?

title: Type Aliases & Union/Intersection Types
content: Type aliases create custom types. Union types allow multiple possible types, intersection types combine multiple types.
questions: What is a type alias?
Difference between union and intersection types?
How to use union types in function parameters?

title: Enums
content: Enums define a set of named constants (numeric or string) to make code more readable and maintainable.
questions: What is an enum?
Difference between numeric and string enums?
How to use enums in TypeScript?

title: Type Assertions & Type Casting
content: Type assertions tell the compiler to treat a value as a specific type without changing its runtime behavior.
questions: What is type assertion?
Difference between 'as' syntax and angle-bracket syntax?
When should you use type assertions?

title: Modules & Namespaces
content: Modules in TypeScript help organize code into separate files. Namespaces group related functionality in a single file.
questions: Difference between modules and namespaces?
How to export and import modules?
Why use modules over namespaces?

title: Decorators
content: Decorators are special declarations attached to classes, methods, or properties, used for metadata or modifying behavior. Requires 'experimentalDecorators' flag.
questions: What are decorators?
How to create a class decorator?
Use cases of decorators in TypeScript?

title: Advanced Types
content: TypeScript supports advanced types like conditional types, mapped types, template literal types, and utility types (Partial, Pick, Omit).
questions: What are conditional types?
Explain mapped types.
What are utility types like Partial, Pick, and Omit?

title: TypeScript with React
content: TypeScript can be used in React for typing props, state, events, and hooks to improve reliability and editor support.
questions: How to type React props and state?
How to type useState and useRef hooks?
How to create generic components in React + TypeScript?

title: TypeScript with Node.js
content: TypeScript can be used for Node.js backend projects, enabling type safety for APIs, database queries, and middleware.
questions: How to setup TypeScript in a Node.js project?
How to type Express request and response objects?
How to use TypeORM or Mongoose with TypeScript?

title: TypeScript Advanced Tips
content: Advanced topics include type guards, conditional types, declaration files (.d.ts), ambient types, and integrating with third-party JS libraries.
questions: What are type guards?
How to create declaration files for JS libraries?
What are ambient types in TypeScript?

title: End-to-End TypeScript Guide
content: This JSON covers TypeScript from basic types, functions, classes, interfaces, generics, modules, decorators, React & Node integration to advanced types.
questions: Create a class with generics and interfaces.
Build a typed REST API using TypeScript + Express.
Implement type-safe React components with props and state.
